telephony_line_assist_troubleshooting_ma: Manual reconfiguration of your device
Returning device to factory settings
Go to the hardware configuration menu (the page icon on the terminal).
In the menu, enter 14 - Factory Reset.
Your device will now restart with factory settings.
Connect a telephone to one of the RJ11 lines on the terminal.
Disconnect the Ethernet cable
Dial then 73738#.
The device will ask you to confirm the reset, by pressing 1.
Your device will now restart with factory settings.
You can reconnect the device to your local network
Press the Settings key (to the left of the navigation keys).
Press 7 to access the Lock/Unlock menu. Config
Enter password 0000
Press 6 to access the Default values menu.
Press Yes.
Press 9.
Press Yes.
Your device will now restart with factory settings.
Restart your phone and hold down the + and - buttons (at the bottom of the phone) for at least 30 seconds (keep them pressed for the entire restart phase).
Restart your phone and hold down the “headset” and “mute mic” buttons (at the bottom of the phone) for at least 30 seconds (keep them pressed for the entire restart phase).
Restart your phone again, without touching the + and - buttons.
Find the device’s private IP address.
Go to the hardware configuration menu (the page icon on the terminal).
Go to menu 9 - Network.
The IP address is the CurrentIP value.
Connect a telephone to one of the RJ11 lines on the terminal.
Dial then 110#.
A voice will state the numbers of the device’s IP address one by one.
Enter the IP address in this field and confirm:
Private IP address
Invalid private IP address (e.g. 192.168.1.1)
Press the Settings key (to the left of the navigation keys).
Press 8 to access the Information menu.
Enter the phone menu and go to Admin → View parameters → Network configuration.
The IP address is available in the IP address section.
Connecting to the interface to reconfigure the hardware.
By clicking the following link: {{ href }}, you should arrive on the web interface of your device, as shown in the screenshot on the left.
Click Voice.
Click Provisioning.
For Provision Enable, select yes.
For Profile Rule, enter the value http://cisco.prov.voip.ovh.net/init.cfg
Click Submit All Changes to save the settings.
For Profile Rule, enter the value http://lk.prov.voip.ovh.net/init.cfg
Click Submit to save the settings.
Click the Login button.
If it asks for login details, enter the following values:
User: private.
Password: lip.
Go to the Upgrade Configuration menu.
Select the HTTP/HTTPS radio button.
In the HTTP/HTTPS URL box, enter http://lgn.prov.voip.ovh.net/ip{{ model }}
In the MAC Cfg. Format box, enter cfg/$MAC
Finally, click Change, then Reboot to save and apply the settings you have just modified.
Log in with the following details:
User: administrator.
Password: 784518.
Click Setup, then Auto Provisioning and Basic Setup.
For the Auto Provisioning Setting, select HTTP preset.
For the Server IP Address, enter the value {{ server }}
Confirm to save the settings.
Click Restart to apply the settings.
Press the button to access the menu and enter the Settings menu.
Select the Reset action.
Enter the admin password: <stong>admin</stong>
Confirm.
Turn off the power supply to your base.
Press and hold the grey button on the base.
Reconnect the power to the base, while continuing to hold the button.
Hold down the button for 20 seconds more, then release.
Your base will automatically reconfigure within the next two minutes.
